From the very beginning, I thought it was some kind of incomprehensible or uninteresting anime game. But over time I found out (or rather when I played the game that I will mention now) that this game is similar to Doki Doki Literature Club, and I decided to review what kind of game it is. While playing, I kept joking comparing this game to the current game mentioned. But it's just a similar gameplay with dialogue and choices that affect the development of events. It has a lot of interesting endings, from which you will either be disappointed... in short, there will be a lot of positive or negative feelings. But the game also has a gallery of everything. Even MUSIC! I love this very much!

There are also mods available in the game, thanks to which you can play the game for days to watch interactive stories. But that's up to anyone.

149274199.review:
First impressions: quite a mix of feelings i have. On one hand Steam recommended me this in play next and the visual novel isn't really my type of genre for solo play. Still, i don't mind and actually quite like the reading format. The visuals are pretty nice, although they seem inconsistent at times. 

The big elephant in the room though.. actually two elephants. First elephant is that from first impression it kind of plays like.. a harem? At start we have a guy that's asocial, doesn't handle the life well and doesn't seem to have a drive to change it. Suddenly he gets Isekai'd into a reality where many girls from the get go seem to treat him favorably. I dislike that stuff and even if the plot is centered around that and mindblowingly justifies it in a masterful way, i still likely would've had a bitter taste from it. That's not how reality works and i'm not a fan of escaping into fantasy atleast in that way.

Second elephant in the room.. oversexualization. There are scenes that have literally NO reason to show a panty shot or show some sexy graphics whatsoever. Don't get me wrong, i do enjoy the curves, the energy, hairstyles etc. of them feminine girls but my dislike for harem fantasy escapism is also paired with dislike for oversexualization. I think in case of games (atleast the ones i preffer to play), the horny mode should be left out of them, unless the nudity or whatever else is unintentional or super brief. There's gf or pron sites to activate horny mode on. 

While there are some decisions, i feel like there could be more and the ''uncontrolled boat sway'' aspect of our character while adventurous, can feel weird at times, especially when i keep on my mind something i'd like to do and something that would make lots of sense to do, but can't be.

Still, the interactions, setting and the intrigue want me to play more - along with the pros stated at the top. I've barely touched the game so there's likely quite a bit to find out. For now it's.. 6.5/10. As stated, i'm not a big fan of playing visual novels by myself and i'm surprised Steam somehow made a recommendation like that. It is a blast playing visual novels with a friend, but solo i preffer other stuff.

148016496.review:
Gave this game a shot ... here's what I found:

Pros
* Ambient music really sets the tone in the illustrations
* Trivia on Soviet Union terminology
* Choices matter as one progresses
* Interactive Campus map (e.g., static image with clickable content)
* In-game "Hatsune Miku" inspired character

Cons
* Illustrations are static
* World view and ideologies of the main character do not further the plot
* Plot moves at a snail pace
* Amount of main character monologues take away from immersion
* Too much fluff material (e.g., lacks plot devices)
* Not enough interactive visuals

Having said that, if you make it to day 3 without getting a headache, this game might just be for you. 

Are you a smoker?
[x] MC is a smoker

Do you lack self confidence?
[x] MC lacks self confidence

I found this visual novel in an atmosphere of a .... dare I say, "Soviet Union camp simulator". For what it's worth, there are communistic behaviors, mannerisms, and demeanor amongst the characters in-game. 

If you read a lot of fiction, this game is for you. However, this game would be better without so much fluff material to read through before advancing to the next scene.

144176365.review:
Рецепт "роснемовлятина по-ДБМівськи"

❗️Декілька секретних порад, як легко вполювати російське немовля: спробуй сховатися за кущем і почни співати "дєнь пабєди". Вони почнуть сповзатися.

Підійди обережно, з невеликими кроками, ніби ти сам став російським немовлям. Потім зненацька стрибни і схопи його руками, але не забувай робити це обережно. В них дуже ніжне м'ясце, яке від ударів легко псується.

☝🏻Тепер, коли у тебе є твоє маленьке російське немовля, час перейти до смачного рецепту приготування!

🥣Інгредієнти:

🔹Російське немовля (ціле або порізане на частини) — 2-3 кг;
🔹Оливкова олія або розплавлене вершкове масло — 2-3 столові ложки;
🔹Сіль і перець — за смаком;
🔹Приправи на вибір (паприка, тим'ян, розмарин, часниковий порошок тощо).

🤯Цікавий факт: Чому російське немовля завжди всміхнене? Тому що воно знає, що всі страви з нього неймовірно смачні!

✅Спосіб приготування:

1️⃣Попередньо прогрій духовку до 200°C.

2️⃣Якщо ти використовуєш ціле російське немовля, добре промий його під холодною водою та обсуши рушником. Якщо використовуєш порізані частини, перевір, чи є кістки, які можуть залишитися в м'ясі, та видали їх.

3️⃣Приправ роснемовлятину оливковою олією або розтопленим вершковим маслом, сіллю, перцем та обраними приправами. Тут можна дати волю фантазії: спробуй додати тим'ян, розмарин та паприку для насиченого смаку, або можеш залишити все просто з сіллю і перцем для класичного варіанту.

4️⃣Поклади приправлене російське немовля на противень для запікання, покритий фольгою щоб не прилипало.

5️⃣Постав противень з російським немовлям в попередньо підігріту духовку і готуй приблизно 40-45 хвилин або доки воно не стане золотистим, а сік не стане прозорим при проколі в найтовщому місці.

6️⃣Витягни російське немовля з духовки і зачекай кілька хвилин, щоб воно трохи вичахло. Тоді можеш подавати до столу.

🤌🏻Не забувай подавати її з улюбленими салатами, соусами чи гарніром. Найліпше смакує з живчиком.

😁 Смачного!

142230498.review:
*Mild spoilers ahead*

-So I came in, not expecting much for my first playthrough, 
-Chose a girl's route at random, 
-It turned out that she was mentally unstable, 
-Pushed on to see the sexy stuff, 
-Found out that it was all completely censored, 
-Installed a mod-patch to rectify this error, 
-But then the text was all in Russian, so I had to translate it all manually, 
-And then after going through this whole journey, I get to a really bad fucking ending, 
-Now I'm left feeling confused at the absurdity of how it all went down, sad at the tragedy, and angry at the stupidity of the characters.

Truly a visual novel of all time. 

*Edit*: There's certainly more to this game than what you might initially expect, and while it could definitely use less monologues, less (in my opinion) hamfisted time-loopy fuckery, and more meaningful choices and interactions with the characters, overall, for a free visual novel, it's still an interesting and entertaining-enough read.

140569793.review:
Every dog is genetically a very good boy

Dogs are genetically predisposed to be man’s best friend.

Scientists have discovered a chromosomal overlap between dogs and humans that could explain why dogs are so obsessed with us.

The new study, published July 19 in Scientific Advances, found that dogs have a few gene mutations similar to ones in humans with Williams-Beuren syndrome. One of the symptoms of this developmental disorder is a complete lack of social inhibition, which makes the person particularly outgoing and trusting.

“We’re not saying we have found the mutation that controls sociability,” Bridgett vonHoldt, one of the authors of the study, told The Verge. “The story is far from complete.”

VonHoldt first noted these similarities in a 2010 study and tested the theory by running a series of behavioral tests on 10 wolves and 18 dogs. Researchers placed the animals in a room with a puzzle box that contained a piece of summer sausage — first by themselves and then with a human. The wolves went for the sausage no matter what, but the dogs couldn’t focus if a human was in the room.

“What they’re really doing is just obsessively staring at this human,” vonHoldt said. “They don’t really care about the task, they’re just interested in the person.”

The research is part of a broader study that’s trying to figure out exactly how dogs evolved from wolves, and came to be domesticated. The team acknowledged that the sample of animals was small and more research needs to be carried out before they determine what exactly this new finding means.

“We haven’t found a ‘social gene,’ but rather an important [genetic] component that shapes animal personality and assisted the process of domesticating a wild wolf into a tame dog,” vonHoldt told Princeton.edu.

While the Russian Culture aspect I was not much of a fan of, as I live far away from Russia, I appreciate how much hard work went into producing this excellent work of art. 

While I liked all of the Girls, Lena was and is still my favorite girl of the bunch. I would happily recommend this game to anyone who likes visual novels, or is new to visual novels.

My Only critique would be the frustrations towards skipping around to other parts of the game, as well as the point system. You need to look up a map and walk through to get the desired endings, but they're worth the trouble.

Thank you for your time.

Instrucciones

137588166.review:
Everlasting summer may possibly be one of the greatest visual novels I have ever played. It's got great music, lovely art, and one of the most complex and rich stories I have ever read. This game certainly isn't flawless, but it's so overwhelmingly touching that you will be able to gloss over the minor flaws. I cannot possibly recommend this enough. The English translations are a bit rough, however you quickly can get used to it. I loved every ending and felt that most fulfilled their purpose, outside of Alisa and Slavya's bad endings, which I felt were quite poorly done, as they had very little content.

Nonetheless, the rest of the endings are absolutely amazing and I wish I could play this game over and over again. Unfortunately I do not speak Russian, so I am unable to enjoy any of the community made mods, but the base game along with it's fan-made sequel was more than enough content for this game to have a spot in my memories for years to come. 

Please give this game a try if you haven't already, and make sure to finish through to the end, because I promise you, the last few endings are so good that it makes it well worth your while. 

Overall, a 9.5/10 game.

134182232.review:
To be honest, didn't really have any expectations for this game.  It looked like a standard "visual novel".  But, having played it for 5 hours... I am pleasantly surprised at how compelling it is.  It is truly a " choose your own adventure".  There are a TON of choices, and from what I have seen, huge divergences in the story and how it ends depending on the choices you make.  Quite honestly, the most dramatic differences in the ending of a game that I have seen.  

Without spoiling anything, but I got one seriously dark ending that seemed like it was going to be a "good" ending, one genuinely good ending which is actually identified as a "bad" ending (by the achievements), one bad ending that was short and to the point, and 1 neutral ending which was pretty unsatisfying and slightly dark.  I did that in 5 hours.  In reality, I was sort of power-skipping through some of the dialogue the 2nd time, though I would slow down for when it was something clearly different from what I had already seen.  

I am 100% going to keep replaying this until I get all of the endings, and this time, I am going to write down every single decision point in the game and what choices I made, because there are so many, if you don't do that, there is definitely no way you will be able to remember all of the choices you made before that point.  I am sure there are guides out there, but I want to do it myself to test myself and see how well my strategy works.  

The writing itself is quite good.  With a surface inspection, it seems shallow, but if you really pay attention, and especially if you replay it... you begin to realize it is a massive onion and there are tons of layers.  Some really interesting, introspective and philosophical stuff.  The "really dark ending" which seemed like it was going to be a happy ending... was all about whether what had happened was real or imagined, if it FELT real and it HURT worse than anything that the protagonist had experienced up until that point.... did it really matter whether it was "real" or not?  For all intents and purposes, it WAS real, more REAL than anything else in the life of the protagonist....

The art can be quite beautiful in places.  I am legitimately going to try to figure out who created that art so I can follow them on Instagram, because it is really good.  

Highly recommend.  This isn't a sex game.  There is sex in it, but not much, and not necessarily.  And, from what I have seen so far... it is actually realistic and credible.  Nothing about the sex in the game is corny, forced, or awkward.  It all makes sense in the context of the story.

132449183.review:
"Everlasting Summer" es un visual novel interactivo que te lleva a un campamento de verano en Rusia en los años 80. La trama gira en torno a la historia del personaje principal, quien despierta en un mundo extraño donde todo parece ser un sueño eterno de verano.

El juego no es tan lineal pues se enfoca en la interacción con los personajes y la toma de decisiones que influyen en el desarrollo de la trama y las relaciones con los demás personajes. La narrativa es atractiva y llena de giros inesperados que te mantendrán pegado a la pantalla.

La banda sonora y la dirección artística son agradables y complementan perfectamente la atmósfera del juego. Las animaciones son simples pero bien logradas y la calidad de la traducción al español es muy buena.

En general, "Everlasting Summer" es un juego divertido y relajante para aquellos que disfrutan de las visual novels, las historias de romance y aventura. Si buscas un juego que te haga sentir nostálgico y te permita vivir una historia interesante, definitivamente deberías darle una oportunidad a "Everlasting Summer".

132081768.review:
[h1]Great Visual Novel[/h1]

I went into Everlasting Summer mostly to laugh because from the outside its an anime style Russian origin visual novel with Мику Хацунэ (Hatsune Miku) in it. I mean come on, it sounds ridiculous. Mostly because of the Russian Miku who I will now be referring to as Muki for the rest of this review. I booted Everlasting Summer up and proceeded to go through the opening and prologue just expecting terrible writing. However I actually started to get really invested in the world because of how well done Everlasting Summer is made. To start, this game actually has a fire soundtrack, the visuals are great, characters are lovable and there is this gorgeous opening scene which roped me in really quickly. The story itself is extremely interesting and had me constantly wanting more and more. I can't delve into specifics as to avoid spoiling anything for anyone. But Everlasting Summer has great dialogue that really makes you care and get invested in its cast of characters. Like Muki.

Now this visual novel is very long. Its something you would take breaks between playing and pick up on different days. If you are someone who prefers short 30 min to 1 hour visual novels it probably isn't for you. On top of that Everlasting Summer has like 14 endings, seven good and seven bad. Half of them you can save before the final choices. But you will have to play through the game at least seven times to experience them all or if you are an achievement hunter. I really recommend Everlasting Summer because I thoroughly enjoyed my time becoming invested in the characters and story. And hey it has Muki in it so just another reason to like it.

129896469.review: This game ran my life for a few nicer-for-its-existence days, and I am grateful to have found it. Among "dating sims" (I know, there aren't any stats, whatever), this is one of the good ones. You aren't constantly dying (I only know one way to actually die in this game, and you totally bring it on yourself), you have tons of options to get the girl (at least for awhile), and even the bad endings still feel hopeful. This game scratches an itch that's hard to define, and so much harder to actually reach, as an adult - that feeling of young love, where there's the real chance you can be with the other person, without all the crap. Idealized, absolutely, and cheese is applied liberally throughout. Still an amazing set of experiences I will look back on with echoing joy.

125477386.review:
I am a 73 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing Everlasting Summer.
I am a single father to my son, who is now 34. My son recently started playing Everlasting Summer and glancing in his room it looked like he was having a lot of fun.
In less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours.
This was awful for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son
because he was always out with his friends or watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam
account to play with my son. I started playing, but this was my first time playing a video game
since the 80's, so I was quite lost. I asked my son for help, and together we spent some hours playing this game.
I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. Playing video games
reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought
me and my son closer again, and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well.

123617384.review:
Everlasting Summer is a melancholic fever dream trip to a pioneer camp in soviet USSR.
I've had a great time playing this game and would highly recommend it to anyone, but especially to people in their early adulthood.

Here's a review for those that might be interested in investing 20 hours of their life into the game : 

First of all, the soundtrack is beautiful and diverse. It is well handled and conveys the intended emotions smoothlessly.

The graphics are pleasing to the eye, especially the backgrounds. They are not always accurate to what is happening in the scene, but they capture the feelings with great care. 

As it is a visual novel, the gameplay is quite simple, mostly limited to making choices. The game engine is quite basic but is more than enough to serve the gameplay. There are options to listen to the soundtrack, to watch a photo gallery and to watch the unlocked endings. All of which are great bonus.

The story is captivating. I was not always a fan of the MC's personality but I was still eager to know what would happen in the next scenes and read his inner thoughts. We feel a large array of emotions, from joy, sadness, fear, anger, etc... The game never feels likes it's trying to enforce an emotion, it just comes naturally. The characters have depth and are authentic, with their lifelike qualities and imperfections. The endings are well conceived and each have their own flavours that makes it worth to try to see them all.

Overall, this game is a great experience filled with nostalgia, I had a great trip down to memory lane. The game being free (which is a steal honestly, I would gladly give $40 to the studio) and relatively short, anyone should at the very least pick up the game and try to finish it once. I wish more games were like this one, that studio would invest more in breathtaking stories instead of tasteless standardized AAA scenarios that have become the norm.

123601616.review: I played this game a few years back and recently replayed a portion for the achievements. This is by far one of the best visual novels out there. Everlasting Summer has a vast amount of decisions that can lead to any number of different endings. All of which are unique and give a different side of the story. I highly recommend.

123137740.review:
One of the most well written visual novels out there. 

I've fully completed all endings available in the game, each of them were really captivating and what's most amazing is that they all are small pieces of a huge puzzle. The developers somehow managed to tie everything together for the people that kept playing their game even after finishing it once, giving us a satisfying and emotional conclusion. 

All the stories all incredibly well written. Every time you'd think you can guess what happens, the story surprises you again and again. The characters do fall into the usual tropes we know, but that doesn't make them shallow. Every one of them has their unique traits, conflicts and phylosophy, it's something that makes every path you take feel like a completely new game.
The deeper you dive into it, the more unforseen outcomes you see, it's something I value a lot in a story, especially if it fits well into the rest of it.

Reading it was a pleasure, but the music is also unbelievably good. I love how the impact of a scene is shaped by the great music. An emotional part is accompanied by a fitting track to truly set the mood, an intense scene is ignited by the powerful tones, the way they've used sound to paint the atmosphere is amazing. (A good example would be in Ulyana's route, when the protagonist is telling her a ,,scary story", right as Semyon is slowly building up his space station universe, the music changes, completely switching the tone just to give more power to the otherwise uninteresting to the reader story. When I got to this part, I wanted to skip through it because I didn't want to waste time on a non-canon little fairy-tale, but when the music dropped, it instantly got me curious as to what I might have missed when spamming spacebar. Just that intense music alone got me to look back and read it from the beginning, something that I do not regret.)

The only negative critiques I could think of would be the sometimes inconsistent art style. Although, for a free game, it's way above standards. Background art is gorgeous, but some of the character sprites and CGs deserved more love.
Another thing that might make some heads turn the other way would be the game's focus on russian culture.
I personally loved it. It's something new, it's interesting and living in a country that once ran under communism, I could recognise some of the references myself, even though I'm not russian. I can see why some people would find that unappealing though and if I could leave them a message, it would be to just put down all your prejudgements and just go into it like it's any other beautiful culture, appreciate it.

Maybe because I've felt myself like I was in the protagonist's shoes (something I'm sure a lot of people did) made me biased to think of this visual novel as something special, perhaps to someone who doesn't really relate to the MC, the story wasn't all that great, but for me personally, I felt like I wrote this game myself in another life and now I'm reading my own thoughts. 
I do not mean this in an arrogant way, it simply fit too well for me and for many other people living in this modern society to the point that it's almost frightening. 

But I digress, this concludes this review, I tried writing it all fancy but even this wouldn't do it justice. I loved it, so much so that I felt the need of writing a review (something I don't usually do seriously).

8.9/10

123044118.review:
A very old-school visual/interactive novel, with many possible outcomes, many of them challenging to figure out how to achieve.  It's a great challenge to manage to see every possible scene, and to get positive outcomes rather than FAIL or an endless loop--both outside the story, and INSIDE it.  A bit of a mind-**** that can intrigue and frustrate.  The novel has many features that making trying out different decisions much easier and less tedious, to see how particular decisions affect outcomes.  So--as long as you are willing to go through it more than once, it is a supremely intricate logic puzzle.  Note that there are some surprise outcomes impossible to achieve if you haven't first achieved some or all of the others, including at least one surprise character.

But I must re-iterate that this is really old-fashioned, but interesting on many levels, if even only for historic or titillative interest....and the MUSIC--Sergey Eybog is a genius, though he's moved on from composing game music to  Sound Design for more major games since this one was made.  But, the music from "Fiber Twig 2"  that Eybog composed led me to all these older Russian games with great music, I even have purchased the composer's catalog (Highly recommended--good psybient is hard for me to find) at Bandcamp.  i use the music to increase my productivity in coding and proofreading my website.

Lots of fun, if a bit tame compared to the frenetic crazyness of current videogames and adventures.  Kind of refreshing to this old fart :)

ADDENDUM:

Soviet Games, the developer, has finally released their new VN just this past summer, many years in the making, I am looking forward to trying it--Love, Money, Rock'n'Roll!

I played this game 6 years ago, and I *still* think about it. It's one of the highest quality visual novels I've ever encountered. The characters have depth and personalities beyond the typical "waifu" stereotypes. The artwork and music are solid. The story takes twists and turns and is incredibly engaging the more paths you go down. Heck there is a fan made story about a certain side character that is so solid, they included it in the game. If you like visual novels, this is one worth getting, absolutely.

119277623.review:
Beggars can't be choosers, so it's hard to find fault in a free game.

Still, Everlasting Summer isn't perfect. The English localization is out of character sometimes, e.g. using outdated proverbs. The MC is a sad heap of poo. Some of the references to Russian 4chan and Soviet culture might be a bit obscure, though in their defence, they do add explanations for the Soviet parts. The background art is lovely, the character art mostly too, except some of the intermediate and H-scenes which were drawn by other artists without any art direction, resulting in two or three completely different art styles

The story is okay, the first run seems to take forever, especially if you don't realize Olga Dimitrievna does not have her own route, which isn't obvious as technically you are the same age as her (in your time) so it'd make sense to romance her. The bad MC ending is actually very interesting, it's only unfortunate they didn't do anything with it. But if you just enjoy the characters and the little world they're in, it's actually a really enjoyable game.

Music is nice and routes do take some effort to go through. For a free game, it has about 10-20hrs value, which is great. If you can skip some of the mediocre parts, the good ones are fun and it's a good past-time during summer months. Looking forward to their next game!

Все пережитые главным героем эмоции я переживал как будто вместо семена все происходило со мной. Множество разнообразных концовок. Только жаль что у Мику была всего одна.

118482891.review:
Disclaimer: I've never played any other visual novel / dating sim before. I wrote this review after finishing the game twice (once blind and once with a guide).

[u]Pros[/u]:
[list]
[*] [b]Beautiful visuals[/b] (especially the backgrounds)
[*] [b]Amazing soundtrack[/b] -- Not only does the music actually sound good, but it also perfectly matches the atmosphere changes throughout the game. When you're in trouble, a heavy metal guitar riff plays. When you're in a romantic moment, a smooth piano tune plays. AAA studios could learn from this sound design.
[*] [b]The choices you make in the game matter a lot[/b] for the story. And it's a [b] pretty good story [/b] (for a visual novel, I guess). The game is played over 7 days and in my two playthroughs, the last 2-3 days were completely different (and there was already a lot of differences in the first 4-5 days).
[*] Sometimes [b]the game gets pretty romantic / philosophical / deep[/b].
[*] I think it allows a people to [b]learn about Russian culture[/b]. There's a lot of references throught the game to Russian culture and if you google them a bit, you will learn even more. Like, this game makes me want to travel Russian countryside and eat Russian food ...
[*] [b]Extensive achievement / collection system[/b] -- I might take a short break now, but I definitely want to replay this game again in the future to get more endings / scenes.
[/list]


[u]Cons[/u]:
[list]
[*] [b]Few choices[/b] -- While the choices in the game matter a lot, there's not many of them. I can't count the times when the protagonist just did / said something dumb / rude and I didn't have any way to influence that. That felt very annoying.
[*] It seems like [b]no character in the game has a sense of humour[/b]. I don't think I ever laughed once playing this game. Some of the characters joke in-game, but it's not funny for the player nor for the other characters (who seem to get offended very easily at everything).
[*] [b]Bad translation[/b] -- Some phrases just sound weird after they were translated from Russian to English. On top of that, there is a lot of typos.
[*] [b]Boring dialogue[/b] -- On the second playthrough I noticed how often the dialogue is so stupid. It is usually something like this:

Semyon: Don't you think this is ...
Semyon: ... weird?
Slavya: What is weird?
Semyon: Nothing.
Slavya: What do you mean 'nothing'?
Semyon: What do you mean 'what'?
Slavya: Nevermind.
Semyon: It's just ...
Semyon: ... it's like ...
Slavya: It's like what?
Semyon: I don't know.
Slavya: I don't know either.

On top of that, between each line, you have 3 lines of internal monologue like: "[i]I wonder what will she say next. She is usually not so talkative. I didn't expect to find her here. It's such a beautiful day today.[/i]"

[/list]

116846964.review: This game caught me by surprise. When i saw that it was made by an indie developer, mostly a single person, I really wanted to try it out. The main reason was the setting. You rarely see a Russian, let alone a Soviet setting for a light novel. Since I come from a country that used to be united under Communism I remember the stories of my parents that experienced being pioneers. This reminds me of that and also the camps I was on during summer. It wasn't too different from how it is shown here. The intro of the game got me depressed a little bit since it hits a little close to home. Then after a few days of pause I decided to complete the game. And oh boy was it fun to experience all the endings this game had to offer. It is nicely written and id you look at the ture ending it is very uplifting and for young people this would mean a lot. You can say that this is made for "Children or teenagers going trough a tough time of entering the world of adults or simply growing up". Sure the bad engings can get dark indeed but the whole point of the game is the good endings. If you just commit to one you can hardly get the bad ending if you just think about it. The characters are interesting, you can find favorites quickly and when pursuing the endings you get quite a few twists, especially with the special endings and the true ending. The game has great concepts integrated into its story and you don't have to treat it as a typical dating sim if you want. The music is awesome. I really love the tracks and the main theme and menu music are iconic. Menu reminds me of Silent Hill for some reason. The sound effects are also quite good and the background art is very nice. Although the character desings are nice their artwork is hit or miss depending on the CG. In the end this game is wonderful and does a great job at spreading the good-old Socialist/Communist culture that people have not experienced or have forgotten about. Also the MOD support is awesome, be sure to check that out or even use it to create your own characters and story.

The game is simple but interesting. To be honest, I liked it when I first played it when I was like 18-19 years old. However, now I'm 24 and the truth is seeing certain heroin archetypes is pretty unbearable. I'm talking about the "loli" and the "crazy one". There are certain things that should not be fetishised.

However I must say it's cool to see so many internet references, the love that was put into this project and how the game is pretty well done (not perfect, but pretty good) for a free game. There are things *I* don't like, but maybe you do. This is just my heads-up.

Also remember to disable the censorship at H scenes!

115317512.review:
I'm pissed because I got the bad end.

But more practically, I didn't like how the game didn't give you enough time to get to know the girls before starting to count your decisions towards a certain path/ending.

Since day 1, you have to simp for one girl, basing your decisions not on what feels right (I answered everything honestly, with a mix of context I was provided prior) but instead on random guessing, or following a guide. And there's no hints on what choice does what, it's just random chance that you'll score positive or negative points for a certain path/girl. There's only 7 days to make stuff happen, only one or two choices per day, and if you're too nuetral, you get nothing but just "coasting by" storytelling. You there's more intense decisions later, but they're ignored/locked if you don't have enough "positive points" for a certain girl.

You really CAN'T answer honestly, or "be yourself" in this game you have to know what choice does what to control your story. (and every decision-making moment comes about every hour or so, with not enough leeway, or extra decisions to give extra padding or properly zone-in on one girl/path. You can nuetralize your path by gaining a point or two for another girl/path if you make the wrong choice).

In the end, I got a kiss from Lena, but that's it, not many scenes or deep bonds with other girls. Just a fun hangout or two. 
Also, the ending was a bit clunky, with absolutely a coin-toss decision to get the "bad" ending or "good" ending, involving the bus ride & the voices.

All in all, I don't feel like replaying, unlike the other visual novels I've tried. I felt punished for answering honestly and trying to be well-rounded, but also focused on two particular girls. (No Mika path until you complete the game once? I wish I knew. Don't even introduce her to the story if you can't be with her.)

Thanks for the game. The art was wonderful and the writing was nice to read, but work on giving the players time to really flesh out their own story, not force them to land in unintended territory for just trying to go-with-the-flow to the best of their ability.

113639411.review:
I had a friend over for a visit and we started making some jokes about dating sims, which resulted in encountering their parodies (hatoful boyfriend with piedgeons etc.), eventually we made a bet to choose one of them and play it together simultaneously to see which result/ending or girl we'll get. 

The moment I saw the soviet background in this one I knew we had to try this particular title as we both are from Czech Republic (you can say we do not share an exactly cool history with Russia... but our dark humor makes up for it I guess - nevertheless we are quite familiar with the pioneer background) so we can kinda relate to this topic on a historical basis. 

First 2 hours I was laughing my ass off. The outfits, the buildings....the vehicles you name it, it all ringed a bell and it was hilarious for us to see it in a visual novel like this. All the popular references were killing us. However I started to slowly acknowledge the immersivity with all the nice painted pictures, cool nature sounds and even the writing was not bad at all, on the contrary to be honest. I really felt like I was being teleported to some strange place with bunch of strange people and I wanted to know all the answers, like how tf I got here, how can I get out, what century it is etc. On the other hand I began to be interested also in the characters you were meeting on your journey.

So what started as a joke suddenly became a really interesting mystery to me. If you would have told me the day before that instead of playing Destiny 2 pvp or Elden Ring on my day off (my gf was out of town) I will be playing this for almost the whole day I would have laughed to your face like yeah for sure bro. But it did end like this and I enjoyed it more. I was drawn to the story more and more and I finished it after like 6-7 hours straight almost (with some food breaks). It was an amazing experience and honestly I kept thinking about the outcoume for a few days later (I a got a bad Alisa ending, which was not completely bad but it raised a lot of thoughts in my head like if I am doing maximum with my life right now and so on). 

So I am definitely looking forward that I will try other endings and maybe some mods (I saw that most of them are in Russian but still few are in English) and I must say that whoever did this made a great job. And it's free to play as well, what more can you possibly want, definitely give it a try if you are just checking it out for fun or for real, it's worth it! Cheers

112593557.review:
Interesting visual novel with a lot of choices leading to 7 different routes with 13 possible endings. I enjoyed the reading a lot but the quality of some routes varies. Certainly one of the better of non-japanese VNs though. Even more so, considering the fact it's completely free. 

The writing and the mystery is absorbing from the start. In terms of story quality, it goes like this: 

Slavya > Ulyana > Yulya > Alisa > Miku > Lena > Semyon

First three listed routes are great as the chemistry between MC and the girl works pretty well and overall message works nicely. Alisa is nice tsundere but her character kinda blends with Ulyana. Miku route was certainly different but not sure about this B-horror movie theme. True end was actually nice, but maybe bit forgettable as I would prefer if all routes meaningfully clicked together, creating bigger picture. Still enjoyable conclusion though.
But I didn't really like Lena - not because her route was depressing but because I found it hard to believe MC would want to voluntarilly spend more time with her after certain point.

In fact, speaking of MC, he surely likes to argue a lot during the course of the story and it gets kinda annoying after a while. He is the definition of drama queen yet at the same the game doesn't really show the reason for it. His childhood is only scratched and just mentioned several times. And it doesn't help the main character stays the same for the most of the game.

I also didn't like the fact that some characters were inconsequential (Zhenya and Nurse mainly - although the first one gets her own route in DLC). Some story elements would also benefit from using Chekhov's gun as they served no real purpose. Namely [spoiler]the mobile phone, the owl, the ghost, the bunker, Slavya dance in the forest or Yulya's provisions[/spoiler].

On the positive side, if you want more, there are lot of other stories to be read on workshop and you can get handful of translated mods here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=725863054 

What I can't complain about at all is the atmosphere which the game constantly maintains so well. This is also thanks to the best background pictures I have seen in any visual novel up to date - the detail is simply unbelievable. There are also tons of CGs, many different character sprites showing their emotions and simply awesome music - like really, the OST is so great.

All in all, even despite all shortcomings, I definitely don't regret I read this novel (I may even read so modded stories later) and I can't wait for the next game [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/615530/Love_Money_RocknRoll/]Love, Money, Rock'n'Roll[/url] to come out.

y aca vamoss..
no me gustan las novelas visuales, por su gran influencia y culturizacion japonesa, suelo evitarlas ya que sus personajes y diálogos suelen pecar de genéricas, odio tener q leer tanto ya que no soy un gran lector recurrente, pero everlasting summer fue la única visual novel que logro engancharme, el argumento es fácil eres una persona de alrededor de 22 años que no tiene rumbo en su vida, y se limita a flotar entre la multitud como un dígito más, un día volviendo de el trabajo el personaje en el colectivo es transportado hacia otro tiempo y lugar, para ser más claros en un campamento de verano en la Rusia soviética en los años 80 aprox.
te ves envuelto de dudas y misterios a la vez q conoces e interactuas con los personajes del lugar, y tratas de descubrir que sucedió y como volver a tu vida normal.

su trama y el desarrollo de la misma es de lo mejor del juego sin dudas, cada vez que lo juegues entenderás menos, tiene subtramas muy buenas, que necesitan de varias rutas para lograr entenderlas, a medida que avances todo lo q pensabas q era se desdibuja y se recrea en otro juego totalmente distinto abriendo teorías que a día de hoy se discuten.
por momentos el misterio y la tensión suelen aparecer y darle un toque tenebroso al juego que le queda muy bien, haciéndote replantearte aveces si este es un juego de drama o suspenso.
sus personajes son carismáticos algunos te pueden parecer demasiados caracterizados al principio, pero a medida que vas jugando sabes y aprendes mas de ellos, las decisiones que tomen afectan muy severamente a el desarrollo de la historia hasta el punto que debes de rejugarlo mas de 10 veces si quieres todos los finales.

107440533.review: It's been a very long while since i've played this visual novel. But from what I remember, this is a fantastic visual novel. The story is honestly one of, if not, the most complex story i've ever read for a visual novel. Each route adds on to the story with small pieces of information and it can be quite confusing for newcomers to visual novels. But once you play through all the routes, you'll fully understand the entire story and what's going on in the camp. The characters are amazing, and are basically the best part of the game. Each one is different from the other of course, but when reading, you get this ominous vibe the more they break their character. It's really cool how the developers expect you to think that this is how they will act but they are hiding something behind that smile or face. The music is very mellow and quite relaxing, and definitely fits in with the mysterious vibe the game brings out. The choices you make will very much affect the story including the route you are going for. You will possibly get the bad ending of that route, which is really cool that the developers made both good and bad endings for each of the routes to make players feel their outcomes. This visual novel is very unique and it's amazing how much detail they were able to put into such a complex story with great characters, a lovely artstyle, calming music, and a good amount of replay-ability. It's very much worth checking out.

106935107.review:
I played this game a couple years back in middle school during some pretty hard months in my life. I left myself to my room and played video games all the time and stayed up late almost every night. I somehow came across this game I don't know how. I saw it had soviet imagery in the background and I thought, "Cool, a VN about history, this will be a fun read!"

What I did not expect was to feel so depressed by this game, the story is surprisingly deep at times and hits home with many people. I can tell this game's target audience was supposed to be directed at people leaving in post soviet states with it's heavy emphasis on nostalgia for those times. I personally was not effected by all of that since I'm an american zoomer that grow up a decade after the fall of the Soviet Union. But the premise of the story about being stuck inside all day go out side actually hit home with me at the time. (Yes, what a clique message, I know)

If I was to find and play this game now, where I am in my life, I'd find it weird and wouldn't like it, but I played it at a certain time in my life where it truly hit home. It's really a work of art and isn't designed to appeal to everyone.

Я ненавижу Бесконечное Лето. Ведь оно отравило и испортило мне жизнь.

В далеком 2014-ом году я впервые прошел эту новеллу от Сатаны естественно, на «титана одиночества». Именно тогда жизнь разделилась на «до» и «после». «Лето» украло у меня нечто очень ценное, и я до сих пор нахожусь в поисках, что же это было. Если раньше я ощущал себя целостным, то теперь во мне как будто бы свербит дыра, и что бы я ни делал, чем бы ни пытался ее заполнить, она не перестает ныть.

И это ужасно, друзья. Эта постоянная боль и осознание, что ее не заглушить, заставляет меня бросать любой проект на полпути. Ведь он ничего не стоит. Заставляет расставаться с хорошими людьми. Ведь им ни за что не покрыть ту пустоту, что меня съедает. Нет никаких желаний, никаких страхов, есть лишь вечное увядание.

Вместе с игрой, из моей жизни ушло лето. Ушло тепло, цветение, и наступила холодная Осень, в которой я и гнию по сей день. Вы бы знали, как это невыносимо: вспоминать былые, настоящие чувства, а потом впадать в такое отчаяние, что ты их не можешь испытать… И ведь даже заплакать не могу, все слезы пересохли.

Много попыток я предпринимал, чтобы покинуть Осень. Новая религия, философия? Все туфта и обман. А может, я болен и мне нужны лекарства? Нет, они не помогают нихрена. Сменить все, бросить старое и начать все заново? Нет. Все одно и то же. А может, найти другое произведение, равное по силе, которое спасет меня?

А может, создать его самому?

МОЕ ЛЕТО УЖЕ ПРОШЛО.

Анон, можешь считать меня ебаным шизиком, но я сейчас плачу. Потому что я не могу принять такую мораль, хотя прекрасно понимаю, что она во всем истинна. И даже то, что в этом есть некая надежда, что после Осени, Зимы придет Весна, а с ней и Лето, как-то не может меня утешить. Ведь я ее понимаю превратно, я пытаюсь разглядеть в Осени ту самую летнюю надежду, когда я должен смотреть на вещи совсем по-другому.


Тут должен быть какой-то вывод, и какое-то послесловие, но я не могу их родить. Я вообще не способен ничего создать. Поэтому просто пожелаю вам всем добра и попрошу прощения за отнятое время.

106120504.review:
It is essentially a throwback to what many Russians imagine the Soviet Pioneer/Komsomol camps were in late 1970s. 

Teaches boys in early stages of puberty how to treat girls and interact with the outer world, after they visit the Hub a 'couple' of times. (unfortunately they won't see this comment, or this novel. Ever)
The game is short enough to grab my attention and long enough to leave a positive review, could argue it is old since it's been around 8 years now.  But don't expect a cliche, but rather a surprise, for the reason above and because it was made in Russia.

Overall the novel, ISN'T MADE FOR PERVERTS or anime lovers. But for an AVERAGE PERSON, who wants to enjoy something different, and will throw a few ideas for someone who is struggling to make progress in life.
Reminding that THINGS COULD BE DIFFERENT.

105253378.review:
In the middle of a cold, snowy winter, Semyon gets on the 410 bus and heads off to his school reunion. He falls asleep and when he wakes up, it is the hot summer and the bus lets him out in front of the Sovyonok pioneer camp. Confused and intrigued, Semyon integrates into this new world, wondering if and how he'll ever get back to his home.

The game consists of a prologue, epilogue, and seven days at the camp where Semyon can steer his way into one of several different endings by making different choices that affect his affinity towards one of the girls in the camp; typically locking into a path by day six. This game is intended to be played through multiple times as some paths don't open until completing the "good" ending for one or more characters. At its heart, this is a mystery novel, though at times somewhat disguised as a romance.

From a narrative point of view, this is a pretty well-written story; the translation is mostly very good; though you'll certainly encounter spelling errors, typos, and the occasional sentence that doesn't make a whole lot of sense. But all-in-all, it's well done. There is a variety of very nice musical tracks that set the mood and graphically, the backgrounds and sprites are all done well. But by far my biggest complaint is in the CG, which for the most part, really isn't very good. The quality of the art is vastly inferior to all the backgrounds, with highly exaggerated facial expressions, coloring that is almost always wrong, and just generally sloppiness; it really is disappointing, especially in comparison to how well done everything else is.

Considering this game is entirely free, there isn't much of a reason not to try it out; though you won't get the whole picture with just one playthrough; I certainly recommend going through all the endings to get a clearer understanding of the world.

*There is an adult patch that you can install by subscribing to it in the Workshop located in the Community Hub. It adds about 20 images but unfortunately contains mosaic censoring; something that is immediately disheartening the moment you encounter it in-game. This fact alone would be enough to change my review to "Not Recommended" if Everlasting Summer cost any money as I'll *never* encourage anybody to reward censorship financially. However, since the game is entirely free, I'll give it a pass here, albeit a somewhat painful one, as it certainly reduces my opinion of the overall product.

105220753.review:
[h1] Una de las mejores obras visuales [/h1]

Everlasting Summer es una novela visual como cualquier otra la cual narra los sucesos de un adolescente en un campamento de verano al cual ha llegado a través de diferentes formas. Parece la típica historia de amor entre un adolescente y chicas las cuales debes atender a través de diferentes elecciones ¿no? la realidad es que no...

Mediante varios sucesos, el juego hace que te des cuenta de lo que verdaderamente está pasando. Otra novela visual la cual me llamó bastante la atención y es similar a esta es [b]Doki Doki Literature Club[/b]. Los distintos finales, personajes con un perfil psicológico amplio, la cantidad de decisiones que se debe tomar a lo largo del juego, la calidad gráfica y la ambientación del juego enamorarán a cualquier amante de las novelas visuales. 

Sin duda, un juego que te puedes encontrar sin previo aviso en steam y no te llamará la atención en absoluto; sin embargo, al jugarlo quedará marcado como una de las mejores novelas visuales. Muy recomendable a los amantes de las historias profundas dificiles de entender y juegos que no son lo que parecen.

My first visual novel, picked up as a forum suggestion.

+ Still updates come, 17. sept 2021 game engine update
+ Remarks about Russian names etc.

+ My playthrough as me finished the game as the main character - Semyon, good end (Forever Alone)
+ 14 different endings based on the selections through the game
+ Many unlocked backgrounds automatically visible in the gallery
+ Install Workshop item "Patch I8 [ENG/RUS]" to apply the hidden content back

+ Fast forwarding option to the next unread selection / text if You play from a previous save or started again
+ Other endings are not just some other minor changes, contain different stories and totally different endings
+ Miku's ending turns another twist to everything

101322425.review:
After my first play through I definitely would not have recommended this VN. The story had lots of elements that I didn't find entertaining. Causing me to set this game aside for awhile before deciding to follow a guide to get each and every different ending. I enjoyed it more going through routes and reading the well crafted/inspiring text at the end of each, and experiencing the different types of stories told. The final set of routes also finally answered a fair amount of what was set up (Though you are left to draw your own conclusions with lots of the stuff they never addressed again).
In the end though the only good parts were the nice little endings. They were inspiring snippets for the main character's life. The rest of the VN suffers from lost in translation writing and mysteries that never are really answered, and that's the part you have to replay over and over.

It's probably just a translation issue but I guess it's to be expected rom a free game. Background art is really beautiful though, so that's a plus; but the character designs look like they could've been pulled out of some 15-year-old's deviant art account. Music was also very nice, sound effects as well. From what I managed to play it felt like a teenage nihilist's wet dream, as the MC is easy to project onto if one has very little self-worth/purpose. Seemed as if the author wanted to make it obvious how hopeless the dude was and how empty his life had been, and thus made sure the player knew that by throwing it in their face. This is just my personal take on it though though, and I didn't give the game much of a chance. Others with more hours on the game seem to have enjoyed it, so different strokes for different folks.

99530235.review:
This was my first and favorite visual novel I ever played several years ago on a different computer/steam account. Everlasting Summer was the game that made me enjoy the Visual Novel Genre to the degree I do today and got me interested in learning ren'py and writing my own private stories. I can't say enough good things about this game. 

This game got me interested in Russian culture and language as well as lead me to research and learn to play 'Durak' which is now my and my brothers favorite card game. Even more so my brother as he asks me to play it with him (while listening to your Everlasting Summer soundtrack, sometimes) on Thursday and Friday nights when he comes over to visit. You could fairly say this game changed my life and lead me down paths and avenues I wouldn't have considered before.

SovietGames is by far my favorite game developers in Visual Novel genre. They found/created the perfect backgrounds, the perfect CGs, the perfect music and the near perfect story that drove my emotions in every direction imaginable. Keep up the good work and look forward to seeing your next project. 

I plan to play this game again sometime just to re-unlock all the achievements (hope they still work...) and relive the good memories. Would recommend this game to anyone without a shred of doubt.

I was ready to give this a thumbs down until those last two endings. The story is like the artwork - it has a great foundation but felt unfinished. 

In the case of the artwork, the backgrounds and some of the scenes (especially horrific ones) are quite good but the cartoonish simplicity of the character sprites was a bit unappealing. I wish they looked as well crafted as the backgrounds. The choice to show graphic sexuality while censoring it was also odd - cropping the shots instead of blurring them, etc. would have been a much better choice.

As for the story, you only get interesting tidbits very sparingly and it takes a really long time to get any answers. In fact, most of the questions are left unanswered, but it wasn't until the final endings that I didn't care. The unappealing characteristics &/or uninteresting nature of the characters made much of the game a bit boring and relationships a bit shallow, but you find there's actually a reason for that by the end.

In the end, I found the overall story sufficiently interesting to overlook the negatives. I believe that most of those were not from the shortcomings of the writers and it really was intentional for the purpose of the story, as the writing was decent much of the time.

97065937.review:
There was something very relaxing about the story for Everlasting Summer. Maybe getting transported to an alternate time and getting to relive your teen years at summer camp beats my usual six day grind and was just comfy. I enjoyed the various characters and liked where the mystery was going as to why I was there and what caused it. I have to say that by the end it just kind of fizzled out for me. I didn’t really feel the story was well explained by the end and I also have to say that given my choices I don’t feel like the ending I got reflected the paths I took. The buildup was good as was the side plots that came about. The art was well done and had a good style to it. Individual scenes did have some issues such as a few scenes where my room mate was supposed to be sleeping across from me but in the scene itself their bed was empty. I also felt the transitions from scene to scene early in the game were strange and took a little long to happen but that seemed to get better as the game went along. The sound effects were well done. There was a card game that is similar to poker with a few tweaks that was also enjoyable once I got a handle on strategy. I didn’t much enjoy a section of the game where you had to choose the correct turns in a tunnel in order to escape because with the lack of a map or any hints it was simply trial and error to do it. 

	I played Everlasting Summer on Linux. It never crashed on me and I didn’t notice any spelling errors. Alt-tab didn’t work. You could manually save whenever you wanted and there were 108 save slots. 

Game Engine: Ren’Py
Save System: Manual
Disk Space Used: 995 MB

GPU Usage: 0-9 %
VRAM Usage: 809-993 MB
CPU Usage: 1-5 %
RAM Usage: 2.5-3.1 GB

	Overall there was a solid game here even though I wasn’t overly enthusiastic about the ending. The journey was good on it’s own right. The game is free so if you enjoy visual novels I recommend it. I finished my first play through in 3 hours and 48 minutes.

My Score: 7.5/10

97023007.review: I was very impressed by Everlasting Summer. At first it just seems like an average visual novel, albeit good for a free one. However, in repeated play-throughs more and more is slowly revealed. It didn't quite click for me until the last run or so, but I was pleasantly surprised when it did. The writing is pretty good, although the translation is occasionally a bit oddly worded. I would have liked a bit more character development as they seemed a bit flat at times though. The art is gorgeous and includes CGs. In fact, all of the features I would expect a good visual novel to possess are there. You can skip, save and load with ease, and the UI is well designed. I liked it enough that I'll likely check out any paid visual novels the developer releases in the future. Overall, I would highly recommend giving Everlasting Summer a try!

95952599.review:
Esta visual novel me sorprendio gratamente. Mediante un personaje principal con una crisis existencial con la que no sabe como lidiar encontramos que aparecenos en un idilico campamento de pioneros de la mismisima epoca de la unión sovietica y ademas en español. (Aunque tiene su pega esta traducción la verdad, aunque sinceramente no se cómo están el resto de las mismas)

Con mecanicas y algunos minijuegos propios del genero iremos profundizando en este por lo visto tan bonito lugar. Pero pronto descubriras que no todo es lo que parece y todos los personajes tienen sus problemas.

El juego se divide en rutas por cada chica y contienen varios finales para cada una, algunas de las rutas se entrelazan y pueden ser un poco complicado de seguirla bien para ir por donde quieres pero son pocas veces.

Sinceramente si quieres ir a por los logros recomendaria buscar los puntos clave y guardaria en ellos. Hay uno clave para todas las rutas que desembocara en uno de los dos posibles finales, por lo que recomiendo guardar ahi para cada ruta que se quiera hacer.

Si simplemente vienes por la experiencia este juego tiene una historia muy curiosa y envolvente convirtiendose en algo a veces bonito y a veces misterioso y tetrico pero con un desarrollo del personaje principal bastante satisfactorio, todo envuelto en esa sensación de estar todo fuera de lugar.

Si no hubiese sido un juego gratuito quizas no lo habria jugado, pero al serlo puedo recomendarlo con total seguridad.

93302046.review:
My first connection with the game was in 2014, when I was only 11. I didn't really like to read at that time, so I've played only for pictures. I wouldn't call it an experience but after playing it (I had Lena's bad ending, which would be kind of rough for a kid, but since i wasn't reading...) my impressions were positive, because of pleasant visualisation

Just a couple of months from now, when the time for me to leave high school and "enter adulthood" has come, I somewhy decided to play it again seriously. I was glad Everlasing Summer happened to be on Steam, free (thanks, SovietGames). I quickly started a download and right away began to *I would like to say "play" but since it's more of a book, novel I think the word "read" fits better*.

GOD WAS IT SO GOOD AND NOSTALGIC, to see familiar faces, and get to know each character's story.
The overall storyline is not really complicated but at the same time it is very interesting to see how the things will end up. Most of the characters make only good impressions, especially Slavya... I was afraid for classic horror elements, like screamers and stuff, but MOST of the routes are just fine with it. I also enjoyed a lot of Soviet art references, like Electronik's character is written from Soviet TV-series "the adventures of electronic", or Shurik, who in Russian film universe is very popular because he appears in Leonid Gaidai's cycle of movies about  Shurik.

The OST is definitelly playing an important role in setting the atmosphere and overall vibe of "careless childhood". Huge props to Sergey Eybog and Between August and December for creating such a good soundtrack and especially for putting it on streaming services. My favorite Tracks could be Lightness, Waltz of Doubts, Lena's Theme and many more

One of the main cons of this novel would be characters's visualisation, I mean, I can believe  Slavya, Olya Dmitrievna, Alisa, Electronik, Shurik or maybe even Ulyana, that things which are happening take place in Soviet Pioneer Camp. I'm talking about appearence, I suppose it has to be 1970s, while Brezhnev really was a "stand out" leader, if you know what I'm saying, I don't remember colorful hair, like Lena's, Miku's (I know she is somekind asian, but still) and the final bus art where pioneers are heading home, you can see I guess "red devil eyes" in some of the fellows. You couldn't really stand out like that from a crowd in Soviet Union, but at this point I find it the only visual con of this game/novel.

To be honest, this game took me out of depression at the time I was playing it, but after finishing... It put me in even deeper depression (ironic) in which I still remain, reminding me how pathetic and miserable I am.
That's the power of this particular visual novel, it digs in the bins of your soul better than any psychologist, and then leaves you alone without instructions "how to continue to live"...
But as I can see, this walkthrough experience will remain in me for a long time. Best Game ever created...

23.11.22 - this is still as relevant as it gets

92507523.review: To those who love visual novels, this game is a MUST to play. As usual, there are good and bad endings to this game. However, what makes this game unforgettable is the experiences you go through in each play through/ending. Every ending has its unique touch to both the player (you) and our MC. Personally, I'm a huge soundtrack fan. If you're also into that, then this game wont disappoint. Many songs listed in the game are tailored to specific characters. What I mean by that is up to you to figure out. All in all, the hours I spent on this game had a huge impact on me. Whenever I see the game in my library, fan art of a character, or listening to the Everlasting Summer soundtrack in music apps, I would close my eyes and remember it all. All the bad endings that hurt me hard to the point where I regretted going down that path for days; as well as the warmth filling my heart and the smile I would have on my face whenever I got a good ending. The playful, joyful, and heartwarming moments mixed in with fighting, madness, and sadness. When I finally reached the end of the game, I softly told myself that it was over. This game definitely left its mark on me. If I could travel back in time to relive those moments, I would. I can proudly say that playing this game was one of the best moments in my life, and I am glad that I have wonderful soundtrack to never forget this magnificent experience.

Everlasting Summer is a VN about a Russian style pioneer camp, which I've heard gives nostalgic feelings to Russians. I of course don't have those nostalgia googles, being Canadian. However, Everlasting Summer is still definitely worth the read. It's not terribly long, probably bringing you at least 10 hours of content, and of course it's free so you have nothing to lose.

There are many routes to explore, and some are pretty well hidden too, so I'd recommend using a guide after going through a couple of the endings. It looks beautiful, and the soundtrack has some real catchy songs, so it's hard for me to not recommend this VN, especially since it is one of the VNs that brought me into a VN plunge over a year ago I have yet to recover from.

89353376.review:
First of all, sorry for my crude English review. This is not my mother tongue, so please not be too harsh.

This VN is really flawed in my opinion. I'm played throw an handful of VN´s so far, so I can only compare this to them in certain fields.
The biggest problem is the crushing length of this game. The monologues of the protagonist are way to long in a lot of moments. Worse, these are full of angst, stupid thoughts and overthinking. I get that this should represent a younger adult, that was thrown in a confusing situation. Maybe driven by events, but still. Some monologues and reactions from his side made me literally scream at my screen. And not in a good way,  I was really annoyed. I skipped through a lot of monologues, I really think the creators should proofread and rework some of these monologues, or even dialogs. This game should lose 1/4 of the text, streamlined and more to the point. That would improve it in my opinion greatly.
The VN itself might be aware of this, because at one point the protagonist says to Slavya hey... you said in two sentences what I was unable to do in one long rambling. Yes indeed. And because of that, reading through these texts was tedious, and it made it more confusing to get the points. As is said, at the end I started to skip through a lot of these.

The other problem this VN shares with a lot of other VN´s. It does not matter what you do most of the time, one small decision give you the bad ending. Or the good ending. And this decision is not grand, most of the time it is something really inconspicuous. And this is annoying. This is a lot of trial and error, with no way to do this naturally.

The game offers you a few choices, but not enough in my option. The are chains of events, that were clearly written that way, and needed to happen that way. This leave the player unsatisfied, because a lot of time things move on direction, that you not wanted. And so far you did everything not to end there. Also, you feel driven by events, but not in a good way. Because most of the time, they are driven by the creators decisions, not by yours. And I understand that this is only achievable with a lot of work, and a lot of paths. I still think this is a weak point.

Most of the characters are not really valid humans, these are constructs to serve a purpose. I’m sill not sure if everyone represented some part of the human psyche, avatars if you will. Or if this really are just constructs to carry the story. So I did not have the genuine feeling of working with personalities, that I had with a lot of characters  in other functional/interactive media. This is just a remark, not really a negative point. Just for people, who might expect something different.

The artwork itself is simple, but do the job. For me it was enjoyable. Also the context with the soviet pioneer camp was interesting, the creators also popup additional information to certain things, that are not widly known outside of russia. I appreciate that.

For the record, I played through the Lena and Slavya paths, that was enough for me. So, in the end, why do I leave a positive review?

I see that a lot of effort was put into this. Someone took a lot of time and hearth to script and write these texts. And I think that someone also used some kind of personal experience doing so. I said the monologues are too long, raw and confusing. Some dialogs are pure cringe. But I take that over something, that was only created with a certain goal in mind. This VN leaves you kind of confused, but with certain life experience, it will also trigger some thoughts. After I played this VN, I had a deep and, in parts,  confusing dream about a love, that ended long ago. So after I woke up, it took me some time to process all of that. With some tears, and some laughter. These memories of mine are pleasing. And also painful. Because they remind me of a time back then, where I was really happy. They also remind me what an empty, emotional husk I am at some times. That I miss something in life, that I learned to live without it. At least on the surface.

But also, that I am grateful for the good things, that happen to me in my life. And to some extent the bad things too, because they form you as a character, and make the good things even more valuable. And that you always take nothing for granted. This is also a motto in this VN. And I can only support that.

So this VN triggered something in me, and every work of fiction that is capable to do this is fine in my book. If you want, you really can think about certain dialogs, and have your own thought  about that. Your own emotions, if you were and are in similar situations in your life. This works for me more than the Asian VN´s with similar  message. You know, make the best out of your life. Be humble, work on yourself, be diligently, follow your goals etc. This one is more emotional, more questioning. Maybe it is more the "Russian" way of feeling and thinking, I don't know.

So in the end, if you deal better than me with the flaws, go play the VN normally. Otherwise, I recommend getting a guide, and play through the parts that interests  you. And don't feel bad if you want to skip some texts, I think it will help you in the end to be not too confused, There are some messages in the game, that don't need this amount of fluff text.
Also, I think this VN works best if you don't just want to see naked girls, or want just a basic dating game. These parts are here in some degree, but in the middle of something bigger. So you might be better off with a different VN, if you want a more simple experience. Nothing wrong with that, this is just an heads up.

87869363.review:
Cada tanto me gusta jugar alguna novela visual para cambiar de aires entre tanto triple A, juegos de rol, de deportes, de lucha, supervivencia, etc; y éste juego debo decir que es una joya, realmente un grato descubrimiento.

Lo empecé, y la verdad es que el principio se me hizo pesado. Creo que es lo más flojo del juego. Repito, el inicio es lento y se excede en montones de descripciones superfluas y comentarios del personaje principal, pensamientos, comparaciones y demás, que un poco aburren. Pero una vez llegado al primer punto de inflexión de la trama, y a medida que empezamos a conocer los demás personajes, la cosa se va volviendo más interesante. Hasta ahora lo he empezado y terminado una sola vez, y es increíble que el juego tenga tantos finales sin que tengamos que tomar tantas decisiones. Pero es que el juego es muy "inteligente" en ese sentido, y se va adaptando todo el tiempo a las pequeñas decisiones que hacemos. Realmente uno termina haciendo lazos muy fuertes con algunos personajes, así como también otros, aquellos que dejamos de lado en alguna oportunidad, se van alejando de la trama sin que apenas nos demos cuenta.

El tono del juego empieza siendo ligero, pero termina siendo crudo. O por lo menos, en el final malo que me tocó a mí, sin hacer spoiler, debo decir que terminó mal realmente. El juego va creciendo en todo momento, así como mencioné anteriormente, arranca con un ritmo lento y a lo mejor para algunas personas como es mi caso, poco atrapante, pero de a poco se va poniendo cada vez mejor.

El nivel de los fondos y las ilustraciones es muy bueno, sin tener un millón de imágenes, pero sí una variedad considerable para los puntos más importantes de la trama. La música es excelente, hay composiciones que son sencillamente espectaculares.

Y por último, sobre el tema de la calificación del juego, debo decir que me esperaba un juego mucho más ligero en donde el protagonista es el típico loser que trata de ligar con todas las chicas, pero ésto no es así. Como en la vida real, el protagonista debe tomar decisiones, no puede ligar con todas, y aunque elija a una chica, el juego tampoco va de zexo (evitando la censura) simplón y gratuito; de hecho diría que se basa mas bien en las relaciones profundas y románticas y en las más de seis horas de juego que he tenido, sólo se vieron unas dos o tres imágenes de desnudos (muy sutiles), y algo más al final (aunque comparado con otros juegos más explícitos, esto es CASI para todo público).

En fin, si te gustan las novelas visuales, ya te estás tardando en jugarlo. Y encima Free to play, habiendo tantos juegos malos a un precio elevado, es increíble que una joya como esta sea gratis.

World building, story, characters, soundtrack everything is 11/10, this game changed me profoundly and made me a better person, couldn't recommend this game more. I wish everyone on Earth would be able to play this masterpiece and see through the deepness of this gorgeous story.
11/10 game, my favourite yet and will most likely be my favourite game 'till my last breath. 
Go give it a shot, trust me, you won't be disappointed.

85710749.review:
The story is amazing, especially considering all the introspection related to dreams and meaning of life. There are many touching moments, as well as scary/unsettling, sad, funny or "mindf***" situations.
The characters aren't too complex, but their personalities are sort of relatable, so it feels natural "talking" to them. 
The game has a lot of replayability, considering the multitude of different endings.
Last but not least, the graphics are gorgeous, the music and sound effects are top-notch, and the game devs gave you all this FOR FREE.

My only minor complaint is that some characters are sort of stereotyped - there is the shy girl with a "hidden" side, the tsundere girl, the happy-go-lucky girl and so on. But this is really just nitpicking.

Even if you never considered playing visual novels, give this game a try - it's totally worth it!

85614658.review: Kind and soul warming story, once you force yourself through the first 7-10 minutes of prologue (protagonist's boring story) and actually get into the summer camp. There are not as many choices (routes) as could have been, but these are high quality, meaningful and involving. Totally recommended!

85372265.review:
Действительно отличная новелла , с кучей концовок , неплохим сюжетом, и неплохой рисовкой. Если вы любитель аниме - то вам обязательно к прохождению, хотя, какой вы бл*ять анимешник, если вы это не прошли? Если вы никогда не играли в подобное и не смотрели аниме - рекомендую к прохождению. 
Хочется отметить дикую ламповость и крутецкие и саундтреки, просто нереальный чилл проходить все это ночью, попивая кофеек. 
Еще один плюс этой игры - реиграбельность, потому что фан база этой игры создало буквально 1000 модов к этой игре, хоть и большинство из них - шлак, взглянуть там есть на что.
Проходил я эту игру ни один раз, и я уверен, что через время, в какой-нибудь теплый жаркий день, я сяду за комп и погружусь в свое новое "Бесконечное лето".

85210973.review:
The supreme visual novel on Steam. At first I found the art style a lil jarring but that passed quickly. This is a really enjoyable, exciting and complex game with lots of twists and leaving enough questions open for you to ask yourself at the end what it all means. I still think about this from time to time long after playing it. Only bad thing I can say about it is that the card game made no sense to me whatsoever and as is common with visual novels, you probably would never figure out which answers to give in order to reach a certain path. I give it a 4.5, standout title.

Don't forget to install the uncensored patch though if you want to play the real deal.

PS: The 0,5 subtraction are for not being able to fuck whatshername, the younger one. Her path still was very good, but it was jarring nevertheless.

83972734.review:
This is one of the best visual novels I have read. If you haven't played it, you are definitely missing out on a great story. It also has some replay value. You won't get bored playing it twice if you haven't played it in a while. 

There's not much else I can say without giving spoilers so give it a try. If you've ever felt lonely, the good ending of the game will help you feel like there is hope in meeting new people. However I do need to note that some of the scenes might be disturbing to some people so if you have problems with that sort of thing, I would say not to play it. It's not so bad in comparison to many other games, so if you've ever watched an 80's horror movie you'll probably be fine. There's steamy stuff too so don't play it at work, unless your boss is cool with it? It's up to you. 10 out of 10 game.

More reasons to try it:

It plays flawlessly on both GNU/Linux and on Windows(I haven't tried a mac yet).

Worked with every computer I could test it on without issues.
Operating systems I've tried it on with no problems, bugs or lag.:
Windows 8.1, 8, and 7
Fedora, Ubuntu, Xubuntu, Lubuntu, Mint.

Works with both Intel and AMD Desktop CPUs ( 1.7 GHz - 3 GHz CPUs were used when tested.)

Also got it to work on two laptops from 2007-2009 with no problems.
Specs for the 2007 laptop used for testing: (Intel 1.7GHz CPU, 2GB RAM)

Specs for the 2009 laptop used for testing: (AMD 1.9GHz CPU, 3gb RAM)

I'm pretty sure a potato would work too. Probably will run on a tablet but I haven't tried that.

It's a Free game. Did I mention it's free?

It should go without saying, but there's always that one guy so... This review is my personal opinion. If you disagree or if you didn't like the game, then just uninstall the game. Not everyone will like this game but I sure did. I really recommend it to anyone who has ever been on a message board, posted on a forum, watched anime, read a visual novel, used the internet, read a cat poster, or used Steam.
